Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Jim. Stanley's back from the hospital today. Can you sign his card?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great. [reads] "Glad they didn't mix up your tonsillectomy with a moustachectomy." Oh that's not good.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, because your jokes are all hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's nice. It's funny. It mentions his tonsillectomy and makes a funny little joke about his moustache.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley doesn't have a moustache.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah he does.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, hit the brakes. Stanley does not have a moustache. I misspoke. I'm not sure. I think he has one, now that- I think he has a moustache.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, Phyllis sits across from him every day. Phyllis, does he have a moustache or not?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. Now I think he doesn't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis! What are you talking- The whole card depends on this!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, the man's worked here for 25 years. How can none of us picture his face?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: 'Cause we come here to do our jobs. We don't stick our noses in other people's business.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, which one of these looks more right? [holds up drawing of Stanley with and without a moustache]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Neither of those looks like any person that has ever existed or been dreamt of in the history of human insanity. That said, the one on the left.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [bell dings] Guys, that's the elevator. What if it's him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, quick. Who says moustache? [Pam, Oscar, Dwight, and Creed raise their hands]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who says no moustache? [Jim, Angela, and Phyllis raise their hands; Gabe enters, hiding Stanley's face]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [reveals Stanley's moustache] Ah! Ha ha ha!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He does have a moustache.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Welcome back, Stanley. [Stanley grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: "Good morning, Robert," says no one because our receptionist is in Florida. [no one responds] Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! [takes out earbuds]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Is this a video conference you're having with "Drake, featuring Swizz Beatz"?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, no, I was just, um, just having a cup of coffee, kind of warming up for the day.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: People, you should come to work already warm. Nine to ten a.m. is the most productive potential that a human being-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Sorry, sorry, everyone, I'm late! But you all are here, so no harm done at all by my lateness.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughing] Nellie, really, nine fifty?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, here's what happened. Seven forty-six, my alarm clock goes off. I hear it. Whack the snooze.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Nine minutes. Bzz! Off it goes again. Whack! Seven more times I did that. Bzz, whack. Bzz, whack! By the time I got up, it was ten minutes ago. No willpower. That is my curse!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughs] I've never believed willpower was very important in a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ah ha!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I don't think you would have shown up to work nearly an hour late for no reason.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, I assure you, I would have done. I did, and I will keep doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. There's something going on. Some stress in your life.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, yes, uh... there is the whole moving to Scranton nonsense. Thirty boxes arrived yesterday from England and two trunks from Florida. Then I have to move in to my apartment in this dreadful, God knows where it is backwater suburb of a suburb, and I mean, no offense but are there a lot of Irish people living around here?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin & Meredith
Quote.Text: [in unison] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ugh! I hate that! No offense.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: None taken.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, Nellie, this monologue you're delivering is very offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: oh! Ay, carumba! The natives are getting restless!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Who's a native?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Uh, excuse me, the tone here is getting quite hostile. I would appreciate it if you would keep that stuff on the basketball court. [everyone groans]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: If you'd let me finish- Or the squash court, or the Supreme Court. Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Nellie?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes, Robert!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You're clearly under a lot of... stress with the moving and the work situation you've found yourself in.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let's help her out, shall we? Go above and beyond today to show her some of that warm Scranton hospitality. Jim. Dwight. Take the day. Help Nellie move those boxes into her new place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The rest of you, let's throw a party at the end of the day to welcome the newest member of our little community.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, we're throwing a party for someone because they're being horrible?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, we're taking work time to move someone's personal belongings into their new apartment.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm still not sure why this woman is even here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why is she here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings] Two crazy kids on the journey of life.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [sings] Going to Pennsylvania.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: On the road with my new girlfriend. But first, a small pit stop to break up with my current girlfriend who is at her parents' cabin in southern Pennsylvania.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. That must be nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. It's a beautiful place. Great place to let her down easy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, I meant that it must be nice to have parents.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh. Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings] Time to have a little kiss!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm. Sorry. Right. No kisses till the breakup is official.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I believe in that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. So do I.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think that's important. That is important. Bummer, but important.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Important.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I can't believe he's making us throw a party for her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She's always late, she's always rude...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It kinda makes me want to throw a really bad party.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: On purpose.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [laughs] We should do it right here in the break room. [they giggle]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Order carrot cake. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...and Jessica, just so you know, this is way more about my love for Erin than anything wrong with you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, Andy, I'm upset, but you did this in the best way possible, and I knew you as a lover and I'll remember you as a gentleman. Okay, that was one minute and ten seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Consider it nailed.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [vocalizing] I think we should try again. This time, worst case scenario.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, here we go. Jessica, I'm really sorry. I just need you to know-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [whining] What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just need you to know-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What is it? I didn't sleep well last night. [they laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lifting box] Ugh! Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nellie, that reminds me. Do you want this chair in the bedroom? 'Cause to be honest, I don't think it's gonna fit through the door.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't listen to Jim. Have you ever seen him play Tetris? "Oh, I think I'll just use this line horizontally. Oh, I had no idea what a gift this line is."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was one time-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will get the chair in. Watch the Great Schrutini work his magic.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Really? Magic? No, no, no. Let's not go there. No, nothing is more repellant than magicians. Bunch of grown men waving wands, pulling bunnies out of body crevices. Magicians are repulsive. Next topic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings] Excuse me, one second. Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, nothing, just hauling some cube with Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shouting] Haulin' cube!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's moving boxes. We just came up with the term to make it sound cooler.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So we're planning this party for Nellie, and we're gonna make it really bad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds like every other party.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. We're gonna make it like a prank. Like order bad food, give her this passive-aggressive card.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Hire a magician.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Trust me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow. There's a lot of cars here. This is just weird.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: [knocks on car window] Andy! Hey, what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Lauren. Look at you.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Well, I know. Look at me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was just on my way back from this business trip, thought I'd stop and say hi to Jessica.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Aww! [clicks tongue]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why is Erin with me? That's a great question. She is my coworker, and she needed a ride because she totaled her car.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Oh. God.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So, I'm Erin. Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yep. This is Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you. [Erin gasps at another girl outside her window] Well, Jess went out for a run but she'll be back soon. Hey ladies, Andy's here!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay Andy, that is a bachelorette party, this is Jessica's friends and they've been drinking during the daytime. Should we go?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Uh, you know, we had such a quick window to make this work, I think we should probably just-

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Oh, Jess! [claps] Look who stopped by after his business trip!

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Andy! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wonder if king-sized sheets are called presidential-sized in England. I really should have a Tweeter account.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, you should.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [finds shoe box] Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reads] "Nellie, don't open, stupid. Love, Nellie."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have to see these shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I doubt that they're sh-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa. Who is this guy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's the two of them taking a hike. I'm guessing he's some kind of friend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's the two of them kissing at a beach and kissing at the Eiffel Tower. I'm guessing he's some kind of close romantic friend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Like a boyfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You read my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Whoa. Here's one with his face whited out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm. Maybe someone threw a pie in his face. New theory- he's a hated Italian politician.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Better theory. This is her ex-boyfriend and they went through some kind of painful breakup.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [walks in] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Nellie. I'm so sorry. We were just...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I see you've discovered Benjamin. That's what I call my box full of photos of Henry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why not call...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: God. We owned this flat together. Then one morning, just like that, he was gone. He ran off with the waitress at our favorite restaurant.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's awful. What kind of restaurant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I couldn't afford the flat myself. So I sold it at a loss. Ah, but what's ten years of bliss down the drain compared with the thrill of starting over with nothing and no one?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry. These must be very painful memories.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If it would help you to forget, I could hit you in the brain stem with this candlestick.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Thank you. No. Look, Jim, Dwight, please, don't tell anyone about this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no. Of course. Just one quick question. Was this um, Halloween, or...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: God, no. That's the most embarrassing thing of all this. What kind of fool gets her heart broken by bloody stage magician?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in the phone] You know what, Pam? I was thinking maybe we should change course here. Let's give up on all this mean stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? No! No, I just had this brilliant idea- everyone loved it. You don't have a copyright on pranks. I might be better at this than you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that's not what I-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Jim, could you give us a hand?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Yeah. [whispers] Call it off, Pam. Call it off, okay? It's way more complicated than you think. Cancel the magician. Trust me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Okay, I will. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pam, we have a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Listen to this.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We're going to have the fluorescent lights flickering. It's gonna make everyone sick.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or what if...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We discuss... [Angela and Phyllis giggle] the idea of doing the party totally normal. Like, not mean. Just a regular party. [giggling stops] Not mean.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I knew she'd crack! I wanted to leave you out, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We're in far too deep. We can't change course at this point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you talking about? Yes we can.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What I mean to say is we don't want to.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Toots, we're not stopping this train, so get off the tracks.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: [pops balloon] Suck it! [cheers, applause]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It'll be fine. Just act natural. Do you want a gummy penis?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, uh, I'll just have some gummy bears.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: These are delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But... they're penises.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: And we come to Matthew. The guy who was with his old girlfriend basically the whole time we were together. [party guests groan]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ew! Aww! That seems gross at first blush, right? But relationships are always more complicated than you think. I mean, we don't know Matthew's history with this other woman. Maybe she saved his life. [laughs] I don't know. I just- I don't think we should rush to judgment about Matthew. Maybe we don't pop that one.

Quote.Speaker: Party guests
Quote.Text: No, pop it. Pop it! [Lauren pops the balloon, party guests cheer]

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Sorry. It's kind of a madhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: [grabs Andy] Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh! Ah, Megan.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: You are one of the good ones, nard dog.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aww.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: No, really. [to Jessica] Where's my Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: I dunno.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, he's out there.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: Aww. Are you going to sing for us?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, you guys are doing a pretty good job with the scary yelling, so...

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: That's not like you. That's not like you. Come on, sing! Sing!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] By yon bonnie banks and by yon bonnie braes...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, they're almost here- What? Come on. If you guys are gonna be mean, could you at least be subtle? [rips down ugly photo of Nellie]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, in the warehouse we use code names for people we want to talk about. Andy was Jelly Roll. Mike was Dennis the Menace. Ryan was douche bag.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, that's not a code name. That's just an insult.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Plus everyone would know who you meant.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, that's a great idea. Let's have a code name. How about Mondays? I hate Mondays? Mondays are the worst?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nobody's named Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, how about we go with Pam? Simple, easy to remember.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 'Cause there's someone already here named Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Shh, here she comes!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Welcome to your party.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Everybody get comfy now. This first song's over a half hour long. [plays off-tune notes]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Best gig ever. They asked me to play only originals. I said, "Have you heard my originals? They're terrible." They said, "Even better." I said, "I get it. It's an ironic party for Nellie."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Maybe we should just go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I gotta do this. Hey Jessica, could I talk to you?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, sure. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, maybe we could talk in private?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, first just let me say that I hope when I'm done with the sort of ugly bits that we can stay friends.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: You're breaking up with me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, no. No. You always do this. You twist my words around. Part of me thinks we should just end this right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh my God. Are you leaving me for Erin? You said she wasn't relationship material and she wasn't as good as me, but it's her, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! That? No. Okay. You want honesty? Super-honesty time. I'm gay.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am gay, and I prefer men.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: I knew it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You did not, Kenny!

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: You invited me to go shopping with you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I like hanging out with you. You're a cool guy. Which proves my point. That I'm gay.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Andy, you're not gay. I mean, we were... together. And you seemed pretty excitable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I was faking it. I had to fake it every time. I had to imagine that I was in a steam room with John Stamos.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: I can't say it doesn't make sense...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well... I mean, I was good at hiding it, but-

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Look, it's fine, Andy. I didn't think we were gonna get married or anything. I just... I'm just upset for now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Understandable. And I'm really sorry. I really am. [hugs Jessica, grunts] So... we should probably... go.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: This humble but sincere effort is all for our valued new colleague. Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: To Nellie Bertram, you are a most welcome and friendly presence at our company.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Why thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, on the other hand, is a most unwelcome, entitled, unfriendly presence in our company.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nellie is terrific, but to be honest, every day I imagine how happy I'd be if Pam died. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Well. I feel that as someone who knows Pam only a little bit... enough. A good amount. Not the most, though. I would say that she is misunderstood and that maybe there's some stuff in her past that you guys don't know about that's a little messed up and probably makes her such a torture to work with.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: We hate Pam. We hate Pam.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: We hate Pam! We hate Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: So we've established-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: -that you guys hate Pam. Do you ever wish she would just... disappear? [sets off flash paper]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! [laughter, murmuring]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That was a really rough scene.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right? Rough scene.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh... at least we can kiss now.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. [gives him a quick kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, that stuff that I said about you to her... I did- That's just- I had to say it. You know, I was dating her at the time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yes, of course. Ah... I feel really tired.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Probably from seeing that turkey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: When we drove by the farm. Oh. Always does it.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: Are you Nellie? Oh, I think you're my volunteer. Come on over here, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll do it. I will volunteer.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: no, Nellie, she-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: Oh! Big guy, huh? How's the air up there? Watch out for... birds. [chuckles] All right, let's uh- let's do some card magic. Now, what I want you to do is... I want you to pick a card just by looking at it. Do not say what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [picks a card] It's the four of hearts.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh, no, you-

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: Looks like we got a guy from another country here, huh? No hablo el cardo, senor? Hmm? Ha. All right, the card is picked. Now sir, will you please shuffled the deck? [Jim drops the cards] You didn't just do that on purpose, did ya?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Why is Jim treating the magician poorly?

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: Little known fact about me. Before I was a magician, I used to work at a rope factory.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not true. 'Cause that's not a real place.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: But I never could seem to figure out those knots.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's not a real knot. When you pull on it, it disappears.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: [yells] What the hell? All right, where's Phyllis? Who's Phyllis? Look. This is really uncool, okay? I put on a clean show here-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay scram, wizard.

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You heard me!

Quote.Speaker: Magician
Quote.Text: Huh!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well Nellie, I'm sorry. If I'd known Jim and Pam would use this party as an excuse to abuse a magician-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, I thought it was quite fun. In fact, I think they're brilliant employees, in their own way. Don't you see what I see?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Interesting. Yes. No, yes, I see that. Great work, team. Great party.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You think this is a great party? This cake has vegetables in it. Like a salad bar, Robert. How do I get this taste out of my mouth?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What? Why are we-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just gotta do one thing. [leaves car, knocks on door]

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: Oh. Hello. Hey everybody, look who's here.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi. Super-duper honesty time. I'm not gay. In fact, I'm so not gay, I'm in love with a girl. Her name is Erin Hannon and she's right there. She's sweet, funny and beautiful and total relationship material.

Quote.Speaker: Megan
Quote.Text: Why the hell did you come back here?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Go away.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Get lost!

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Get out!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: You're done!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bye guys.

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: Get out! You ruined my party! Who does that? Are you kidding me? [Andy and Erin run to the car] Yeah, run away!

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: You're disgusting!

Quote.Speaker: Lauren
Quote.Text: I can't believe you're not gay! [Andy and Erin kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Yeah get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Various
Quote.Text: Don't come back. [someone throws food at the car]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh-oh! [laughs, they drive away]

Quote.Speaker: Various
Quote.Text: You don't even know how to drive! Bye Andy! Loser! Nice car!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Hank.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Yes ma'am.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought I was very specific about you not letting up a magician.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Yes ma'am. I got my eyes open.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, turns out he actually made it up there.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: What? That ain't right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he came and went.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Wait a minute! You said it was a magician, right? [Pam nods] You don't think he could've used... it couldn't have been...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's just- let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Night-night.
